title: Apple's battle with Facebook comes down to privacy, but the iPhone maker has a conflict of interest issue of its own
text: If you pay attention to the tech industry at all, it would be hard to miss the battle between Facebook and Apple over the iPhone-maker's upcoming software update. Known as App Tracking Transparency, the update will require app developers to request permission before they can track users.Â  Facebook is clearly not a fan of that move, mostly because of the very real effect it could have on its advertising business, which is entirely based on tracking and then monetizing your personal information.

title: Facebook shares remain in a bull market supported by Q4 results
text: Facebook (NASDAQ: FB) shares have advanced last week more than 3% and continue to trade in a bull market. Facebook reported better-than-expected Q4 results this January, and the company expects stable or accelerating growth in the first half of 2021.

title: Is big tech now just too big to stomach?
text: The Covid crisis has turbo-charged profits and share prices. But are the big six now too powerful for regulators to ignore?
